meanings.definition: a planned movement or series of moves
meanings.sent1: The military commander ordered a clever manoeuver to outsmart the enemy.
meanings.sent2: The dancers executed a flawless manoeuver during the performance.
meanings.sent3: The cat's sneaky manoeuver to steal the fish from the table was caught on camera.
meanings.sent4: Her manoeuver to navigate through the crowded room was like a graceful dance.
meanings.sent5: The quarterback's winning manoeuver in the final seconds of the game amazed the crowd.

meanings.sent1: She had to manoeuver the large box through the narrow doorway.
meanings.sent2: The skilled driver manoeuvered through heavy traffic with ease.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to manoeuver the hot pan without burning himself.
meanings.sent4: He had to manoeuver his way through the maze of obstacles in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The acrobat expertly manoeuvered through the challenging obstacle course.

meanings.sent1: Her clever manoeuver in the negotiation secured a great deal for her company.
meanings.sent2: The chess player's winning manoeuver surprised his opponent.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's witty manoeuver had the audience laughing uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: The detective's brilliant manoeuver solved the mysterious case.
meanings.sent5: The politician's strategic manoeuver gained him support from unexpected quarters.

meanings.definition: to manipulate or manage with skill
meanings.sent1: He tried to manoeuver the conversation away from the sensitive topic.
meanings.sent2: The magician deftly manoeuvered the cards to perform a stunning trick.
meanings.sent3: She had to manoeuver the situation carefully to avoid any misunderstandings.
meanings.sent4: The coach manoeuvered the team to victory with his clever tactics.
meanings.sent5: The artist skillfully manoeuvered the brush to create a masterpiece on canvas.
